Documentation.Overview:
Displays a running "characters left" count under a textarea.

Attach it to any HTML textarea:

            <textarea rows="10" cols="10"></textarea>

Basic usage specifing a max character count of 400. If not specified, defaults to 140.

            jQuery(document).ready(function(){
                $("textarea").textmeter(400);
            });

There are several options to allow you to customize your PT Textmeter. These can be set using a second parameter, like so:

            jQuery(document).ready(function(){
                $("textarea").textmeter(250, 
                {
                    pulse: false,
                    className: "myTextmeter"
                });
            });
Documentation.Example: Begin typing into the box below to see PT Textmeter in action.

Option.Name: container
Option.Desc: The markup container to add the Textmeter to.
Option.Example:
Create a textmeter specifying its markup container.

                    $(".selector").textmeter(250, { container: "
" });

Option.Name: className
Option.Desc: The CSS class to assign to the Textmeter.
Option.Example:
Create a textmeter specifying its CSS class.

                    $(".selector").textmeter(250, { className: "myClass" });

Option.Name: format
Option.Desc: The markup format of the Textmeter. The token {n} is replaced with the remaining character count.
Option.Example:
Create a textmeter specifying its markup format.

                    $(".selector").textmeter(250, { format: "
You have {n} characters left." });

Option.Name: pulse
Option.Desc: Whether to pulse, or flash, when the characters remaining count drops below zero.
Option.Example:
Create a textmeter specifying whether to pulse when the characters remaining count drops below zero.

                    $(".selector").textmeter(250, { pulse: false });

Option.Name: delay
Option.Desc: The number of milliseconds to delay before updating the Textmeter after its textarea is changed.
Option.Example:
Create a textmeter specifying a delay in milliseconds.

                    $(".selector").textmeter(250, { delay: 100 });

Option.Name: ignoreRegex
Option.Desc: A Regex expression that specifies text that should not be counted when considering the characters left. The corresponding option ignoreReplacementSize gives you the option to specify a constant to deduct from the characters left instead of the string length count. This is useful when using URL shorteners.
Option.Example:
Create a textmeter that ignores URLs when considering the number of characters left.

                    $(".selector").textmeter(250, { ignoreRegex: /(^|<|\s)(www\..+?\..+?)(\s|>|$)/g });

Option.Name: ignoreReplacementSize
Option.Desc: Used in conjunction with the ignoreRegex option, this specifies a constant value for the character count that matches the Regex expression. This is useful when using URL shorteners.
Option.Example:
Create a textmeter that treats all URLs as 7 characters, regardless of their length.

                    var urlRegex = /(^|<|\s)(www\..+?\..+?)(\s|>|$)/g;
                    $(".selector").textmeter(250, { ignoreRegex: urlRegex, ignoreReplacementSize: 7 });
